intro: Anil bifrons, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Anil bifrons is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
